meanings.def: a track with rails on which trains run
a system of tracks, together with the trains that run on them, and the organization and people needed to operate them
examples: This town got a lot bigger when the railroad came in the 1860s.

meanings.def: to force somebody to do something before they have had enough time to decide whether or not they want to do it
examples: be railroaded into doing something I will not be railroaded into signing something I don't agree with.
be railroaded into something We were railroaded into a poor deal.

meanings.def: to make a group of people accept a decision, law, etc. quickly by putting pressure on them
examples: be railroaded through something The bill was railroaded through the House.
be railroaded through The changes were railroaded through.

meanings.def: to decide that somebody is guilty of a crime, without giving them a fair trial
examples: be railroaded He knows he's being railroaded.
